articles.title: JULY, 1970
articles.summary: This document from July 1970 lists the key officers of an organization, including the President, Vice-President, Secretary, and Treasurer. Each officer's name and contact phone number are provided, serving as a brief organizational directory for that month.

articles.title: ANNUAL BANQUET
articles.summary: The San Jose Astronomical Association (SJAA) is hosting its Annual Banquet on Saturday, July 11th, at Berry Farm in Santa Clara, featuring a choice of baked ham or beef stroganoff. Dr. Jeffrey Scargle from Lick Observatory will present on "Some Thoughts On Extra-Terrestrial Life," and new SJAA officers for 1970-71 will be inaugurated. Tickets, priced at $4.25, must be purchased from Emmet Murphy by July 4th.

articles.title: BOARD MEETING
articles.summary: A board meeting is scheduled for Friday, July 17th, at 8 PM at Jerry Schad's residence. The agenda for this meeting includes planning for an August public-relations star party, finalizing details for the upcoming August general meeting, and outlining the September meeting.

articles.title: STARPARTIES
articles.summary: The article announces three upcoming star parties for June, July, and August. These include a picnic-starparty at the LERA-Cothran Observatory site to showcase ongoing construction and night sky conditions, a regular starparty at the same L-CO site, and an overnight starparty at Fremont Peak State Park. The events aim to engage new members and provide observing opportunities.

articles.title: BIG P-R STARPARTY
articles.summary: The San Jose Astronomical Association (SJAA) is organizing a large public-relations starparty on Saturday, August 8, at their old Skyline site. The event aims to attract new members by introducing the general public to amateur astronomy under dark skies, featuring views of the crescent moon, M57, and early Perseid meteors. Club members are urged to assist with extensive publicity efforts and to bring their telescopes and expertise to the starparty.

articles.title: WAA-ALPO CONVENTION (notice from Sacramento--)
articles.summary: The article announces the 1970 joint convention of the Association of Lunar and Planetary Observers (ALPO) and Western Amateur Astronomers (WAA), to be held in Sacramento on August 20-22. It details efforts to reduce costs, available accommodations, and a variety of activities including a dedicated session for total eclipse observations, tours, and a craft class. Comprehensive instructions are provided for paper submissions, including deadlines and formatting for 'camera ready' copy, alongside information for exhibits and general convention inquiries.
keywords: Association of Lunar and Planetary Observers (ALPO)

articles.title: SJAA DUES
articles.summary: The SJAA (San Jose Astronomical Association) is reminding its members that annual dues are due, noting that only 36 out of 65 members have paid. Dues are $9 ($15 optional contributing) per year and include a Sky and Telescope subscription. New members who already subscribe to S&T will receive a pro-rata refund.

articles.title: ELECTIONS ARE OVER!
articles.summary: Elections for 1970-71 are complete, with officer announcements expected at the July banquet. New board members for 1970-72 include Dave Erickson, Clayton Neece, Bruce Smith, and Mike Szudy, while Trudy E. fills a vacant board position. Bruce Smith has also been appointed as the new librarian.

articles.title: ET CETERA
articles.summary: This "ET CETERA" column features various updates from the San Jose Astronomical Association (SJAA), including the disappointing observation of Comet Bolelli and progress on the SJAA Observatory construction. It highlights members' astronomical activities, introduces a new librarian, welcomes a returning member, and mentions an upcoming meteor shower. The article also includes humorous anecdotes and a skeptical take on an observing tip.

articles.title: June
articles.summary: The document announces a PICNIC-STARPARTY scheduled for Saturday, June 27, to be held at the LERA-Cothran site. Participants are instructed to meet at Dave Erickson's address, 4112 Camden Ave, between 5:30 PM and 4 PM.

articles.title: July
articles.summary: The July schedule outlines various events, including a starparty on the 3rd and the annual banquet on the 11th, which features a talk by Dr. Jeffrey Scargle on extraterrestrial life and the inauguration of new SJAA officers. Key deadlines are noted for banquet tickets and WAA-ALPO paper submissions, alongside a board meeting and the maximum for the Delta Aquarid Meteor Shower.

articles.title: August
articles.summary: This document outlines a busy schedule for August, featuring multiple star parties, including a significant public relations event, and regular meetings for an astronomical association. Key astronomical phenomena highlighted are the peak of the Perseid Meteor Shower and a partial lunar eclipse. The month also includes a convention in Sacramento for Western Amateur Astronomers and the Association of Lunar and Planetary Observers.

articles.title: September
articles.summary: The document outlines the schedule for September, highlighting three key events for the SJAA: a general meeting on Sept 4, an overnight star party at Fremont Peak on Sept 5, and a board meeting on Sept 11. It serves as an announcement for upcoming club activities.

articles.title: NOTICE
articles.summary: This "NOTICE" outlines new, extremely stringent and satirical absenteeism policies for officers and board members, rejecting common excuses like sickness, death of others, and leave for operations. It humorously dictates that one's own death requires a two-week notice for job training and restricts restroom breaks alphabetically. The document, issued by "THE ADMINISTRATION" and associated with the San Jose Amateur Astronomers, serves as a clear parody of overzealous workplace regulations.

articles.title: PICNIC-STARPARTY
articles.summary: An event called "PICNIC-STARPARTY" is scheduled to take place at the LEAR-Griffith Observatory site in the Santa Cruz Mountains. Attendees are instructed to meet at a specific location between 3:30 and 4 PM to join a caravan to the site, bringing a picnic supper, sleeping bag, telescope, and bug repellent. The moon will rise after midnight, and directions are provided for latecomers via marked road signs.
